intro: Packera tridenticulata, commonly known as the three-toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It features basal leaves that are heart-shaped with three distinct teeth, giving it its common name. The flowers are small and yellow, blooming in the summer months.
